response:
The presenting timeline (7 days of swelling) suggests a subacute process, though the neurological findings may represent a chronic condition revealed by the edema. Guillain-Barré Syndrome (AIDP) must be considered given the areflexia and weakness, despite the preservation of gait. Metabolic, nutritional, and inflammatory causes are high on the list given the sensorimotor involvement.
